wikitext.*:
'''Morwen''' means "Dark Maiden" in [[Sindarin]] (from ''[[môr]]'', "darkness, dark, night" and ''[[gwenn]]'', "maiden"), and can refer to:

== Middle-earth ==
* '''[[Morwen|Morwen Eledhwen]] ({{FA|443}} - c. {{FA|500|n}}), wife of [[Húrin]] and mother of [[Túrin]], [[Urwen]], and [[Nienor]]'''
** [[Tol Morwen]], an island in the sea after the drowning of [[Beleriand]] on which stood the [[Stone of the Hapless]] and the grave of '''Morwen Eledhwen'''
* [[Morwen (daughter of Belecthor)|Morwen]] (fl. c. {{TA|2600}}), daughter of [[Ruling Steward|Steward]] [[Belecthor I]] of [[Gondor]] and grandmother of [[Egalmoth (Steward of Gondor)|Egalmoth]]
* [[Morwen Steelsheen]] (born {{TA|2922}}), wife of [[Kings of Rohan|King]] [[Thengel]] of [[Rohan]] and mother of [[Théoden]].
* [[Morwen (daughter of Húrin)|Morwen, daughter of Húrin of the Keys]], an discarded character in the drafts of the [[Appendices]]

== Adaptations ==
* [[Morwen (film character)]], a character invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]''.
* [[Morwen (Electronic Arts character)]], a character invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]''.

== Other ==
* "Morwen" was also the name of [[Moria]] in the closed-captioning of bootlegged Chinese copies of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]''.
* "Morwen Nerdbane" was a name used in [[Tolkien's works in popular media#American Dad!|American Dad!]] in parody of fantasy in general.
* "Morwen" is an alias sometimes used by [[Thomas Morwinsky]]
